app.title: Visualization of Central Limit Theorem for Impulse Responses

distribution.title: Probability Distribution
distribution.coinDescription: Distribution of the number of heads when a coin is flipped n times.
distribution.diceDescription: Distribution of the sum of outcomes when a six-sided die is rolled n times.
distribution.diceLoadedDescription: Distribution of the sum of outcomes when a loaded die is rolled n times.
distribution.degenerateDescription: All probability mass concentrated at a single point.
distribution.latticeDescription: A special case of lattice distribution (discrete distribution where all possible values can be represented in the form a+bn, where a, b≠0 and n is an integer) with uniform probability at equally spaced discrete points.
distribution.firDescription: Example of impulse response of FIR low-pass filter. It does not satisfy the conditions for a probability distribution because it is not non-negative.
distribution.customFirDescription: Custom FIR filter impulse response with 11 samples adjustable from -1 to 1. Normalized by the sum of absolute values.
distribution.iirDescription: Example of impulse response of IIR low-pass filter. It does not satisfy the conditions for a probability distribution because it is not non-negative.
distribution.differentialDescription: Discrete-time difference, impulse response of a first-order IIR high-pass filter. It does not satisfy the conditions for a probability distribution because it is not non-negative.
distribution.differentialCentralDescription: Discrete-time central difference, equivalent to a second-order difference impulse response. It does not satisfy the conditions for a probability distribution because it is not non-negative.
distribution.zetaDescription: Discrete power-law distribution (discrete version of Pareto distribution).
